[useDelay](https://devboldly.github.io/react-use-precision-timer/useDelay)

Fires the callback after the specified delay has passed.
@param delay The amount of time, in milliseconds, before the timer fires.
@param callback Called when the timer fires.","displayName":"useDelay","methods":[],"props":{}},{"description":"See documentation: [useStopwatch](https://devboldly.github.io/react-use-precision-timer/useStopwatch)

Runs indefinitely, counting elapsed time, until paused or stopped.","displayName":"useStopwatch","methods":[],"props":{}},{"description":"See documentation: [useTimer](https://devboldly.github.io/react-use-precision-timer/useTimer)

A versatile precision timer hook for React. Doubles as a stopwatch.

- Based on `setTimeout()` and timestamps, not `setInterval()` or ticks.
- Features perfect mean interval accuracy, meaning it doesn't wander.
- Resilient to expensive callback operations and low timer delays.
- Can be used as a timer or a stopwatch.
- Supports starting, stopping, pausing, and resuming.
- Includes accessors for everything under the sun.","displayName":"useTimer","methods":[],"props":{"delay":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"Amount of time to wait before firing the timer, in milliseconds. Use `undefined` or `0` if you'd like the timer to behave as a stopwatch, never firing.","name":"delay","required":false,"type":{"name":"number | undefined"}},"callback":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"The callback to call when the timer fires. Must provide a `delay` for the timer to fire.","name":"callback","required":false,"type":{"name":"(() => void) | undefined"}},"runOnce":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"Use `true` to only run the timer once, `false` otherwise.","name":"runOnce","required":false,"type":{"name":"boolean | undefined"}},"fireImmediately":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"Use `true` if the timer should fire immediately, calling the provided callback when starting. Use `false` otherwise.","name":"fireImmediately","required":false,"type":{"name":"boolean | undefined"}},"startImmediately":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"Use `true` if the timer should start immediately, `false` if you'd like to call `start()` yourself.","name":"startImmediately","required":false,"type":{"name":"boolean | undefined"}},"fireOverdueCallbacks":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"There is a failsafe built in for very low delays (less than 10ms) and expensive callback operations, which sometimes cause the timer to not fire fast enough. You can use `true` to disable the failsafe. With no failsafe, the callback will always be called the exact number of times expected, even when calls are overdue. Be aware that if the callback is expensive (takes longer than the delay), this may lead to a crash. When `false` (default), the failsafe is enabled and calls to the callback will be skipped when the timer can't keep up. Only set this to `true` if your callback isn't expensive. Default `false`.","name":"fireOverdueCallbacks","required":false,"type":{"name":"boolean | undefined"}}}}]},{"key":"src/hooks/useDelay.tsx","value":[{"description":"See documentation: [useDelay](https://devboldly.github.io/react-use-precision-timer/useDelay)

Fires the callback after the specified delay has passed.
@param delay The amount of time, in milliseconds, before the timer fires.
@param callback Called when the timer fires.","displayName":"useDelay","methods":[],"props":{}}]},{"key":"src/hooks/useStopwatch.tsx","value":[{"description":"See documentation: [useStopwatch](https://devboldly.github.io/react-use-precision-timer/useStopwatch)

Runs indefinitely, counting elapsed time, until paused or stopped.","displayName":"useStopwatch","methods":[],"props":{}}]},{"key":"src/hooks/useTimer.tsx","value":[{"description":"See documentation: [useTimer](https://devboldly.github.io/react-use-precision-timer/useTimer)

A versatile precision timer hook for React. Doubles as a stopwatch.

- Based on `setTimeout()` and timestamps, not `setInterval()` or ticks.
- Features perfect mean interval accuracy, meaning it doesn't wander.
- Resilient to expensive callback operations and low timer delays.
- Can be used as a timer or a stopwatch.
- Supports starting, stopping, pausing, and resuming.
- Includes accessors for everything under the sun.","displayName":"useTimer","methods":[],"props":{"delay":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"Amount of time to wait before firing the timer, in milliseconds. Use `undefined` or `0` if you'd like the timer to behave as a stopwatch, never firing.","name":"delay","required":false,"type":{"name":"number | undefined"}},"callback":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"The callback to call when the timer fires. Must provide a `delay` for the timer to fire.","name":"callback","required":false,"type":{"name":"(() => void) | undefined"}},"runOnce":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"Use `true` to only run the timer once, `false` otherwise.","name":"runOnce","required":false,"type":{"name":"boolean | undefined"}},"fireImmediately":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"Use `true` if the timer should fire immediately, calling the provided callback when starting. Use `false` otherwise.","name":"fireImmediately","required":false,"type":{"name":"boolean | undefined"}},"startImmediately":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"Use `true` if the timer should start immediately, `false` if you'd like to call `start()` yourself.","name":"startImmediately","required":false,"type":{"name":"boolean | undefined"}},"fireOverdueCallbacks":{"defaultValue":null,"description":"There is a failsafe built in for very low delays (less than 10ms) and expensive callback operations, which sometimes cause the timer to not fire fast enough. You can use `true` to disable the failsafe. With no failsafe, the callback will always be called the exact number of times expected, even when calls are overdue. Be aware that if the callback is expensive (takes longer than the delay), this may lead to a crash. When `false` (default), the failsafe is enabled and calls to the callback will be skipped when the timer can't keep up. Only set this to `true` if your callback isn't expensive. Default `false`.","name":"fireOverdueCallbacks","required":false,"type":{"name":"boolean | undefined"}}}}]},{"key":"src/__docz__/components/UseDelayExample.tsx","value":[]},{"key":"src/__docz__/components/UseTimerExample.tsx","value":[]},{"key":"src/gatsby-theme-docz/components/Logo/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"Logo","methods":[],"actualName":"Logo"}]},{"key":"src/gatsby-theme-docz/components/MainContainer/index.js","value":[{"description":"","displayName":"MainContainer","methods":[],"actualName":"MainContainer"}]}]}
